website_summaries.verdict: Pure egg white protein for the athlete looking to add muscle without the added ingredients.
pros: Each scoops is the same as eating seven egg whites
Offered in vanilla custard or rich chocolate flavors
Designed for pre- or post-workout use
Less than 1 gram of sugar per serving
cons: Contains artificial sweeteners that aren't suggested for those with allergies

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, and I realize there is supposed to be an egg shortage due to avian flu, but this just amounts to price gouging. Look at the cost of this product as I have purchased it over time. Be aware that it is not normal to pay $77 for 2 pounds of non-organic egg protein. I am thinking about going with a vegetable protein instead because a 75% markup is too much to pay for the supposed "bioavailability" of egg. 8/5/2012: $33.98 8/15/2012: $34.75 11/15/2012: $25.15 11/27/2012: $33.95 2/1/2014: $35.69 4/10/2014: $36.58 8/6/2014: $44.89 8/31/2015: $77.49
customer_reviews.author: Block Google Spiders

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I gave Optimum Nutrition 100% Egg Protein three out of five stars because it was not kind to my digestive system (just like whey). If you have no problem with highly concentrated egg protein, I recommend this, because it mixes fairly easily and doesn't leave useless grains behind like Body Fortress. It does taste odd, though. If you do have problems with whey, egg, or even vegan protein, try Muscle Meds' Carnivor Beef protein isolate. They have smoothie compatible flavors (vanilla, chocolate) and fruit drink flavors (if you're tired of the smoothie flavors).
customer_reviews.author: Femi Fatusin

customer_reviews.title: Mixes real nicely, tastes great (unless you mix with water
customer_reviews.text: Mixes real nicely, tastes great (unless you mix with water, i mix all of mine with almond milk). Though only issue i have is the sodium is a little high at 440mg.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Egg Protein
customer_reviews.text: I have asthma, and dairy heavy products cause problems for me. That said, this is the best non-dairy protein I've ever tried. I was really bummed when ON went through and raised prices to distributors, causing such a large price hike on all of their products. It was a no-brainer at ~$35, but it's pushing the boundaries of common sense at the current $45-50 compared to the not-quite-as-good alternatives that are much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Menace

customer_reviews.title: as expected but taste is lacking
customer_reviews.text: this protein arrived as expected and was as advertised. i'm not crazy about the egg taste, which perhaps should have been expected by the "custard" part of the flavor name. i was able to add a small amount of straight cocoa powder to each serving to mask the egg-ie taste and make it through the 2 pounds. i wanted to try the egg protein as an option to get away from the dairy in the whey protein, i'll be looking for other options, but only from a taste standpoint. the powder itself was as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: the most easily digestible of all proteins
customer_reviews.text: Ahh egg protein, the most easily digestible of all proteins. I use this because of extreme lactose intolerance prevents me from using most whey proteins and I'm quite satisfied with it. It tastes alright, not bad but not great either. I wish it had less artificial sweeteners in it. I can tolerate a worse taste for a healthier product. Overall, very satisfied though. The protein is micronized enough to allow effective mixing with just a spoon, though a shaker is definitely better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have used the whey protein over the years and my body just doesn't seem to like it. I even bought some of the most expensive whey and when it came time to take it, inside, I fought it, not for the taste, my body just didn't want it. I decided to try the egg protein even though it is a bit pricey. Well, all I can say is it goes down and my body likes it. For me, I like the chocolate flavor a lot and I find it mixes very easy in my Shaker with the wire ball in it. I hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Egg Protein
customer_reviews.text: I switched to egg protein over whey about a month and a half or so ago. Its a little more expensive then syntha 6. But I feel a difference. The whey protein would give me the bubble guts most of the time and I heard about egg protein and thought id give it a try. I love it.. The taste is okay you just have to get used to it. I usually just put it in water and throw in a oreo cookie in there and its pretty good. Its a lot healthier for you too and less fat in each serving and no more bubble guts for me :)
customer_reviews.author: _hoezer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product, OPTIMUM NUTRITION 100%EGG to anyone having a problem finding a protein product.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this product. I have tried others that were gritty, caused me to be nauseous and some just tasted awful. I blend the OPTIMUM NUTRITION 100% EGG in my smoothies. It taste great.
customer_reviews.author: Stella L.

customer_reviews.title: $20 Price Increase?
customer_reviews.text: Unlike a lot of the supplements I buy, I actually like and use this stuff! Went to replenish my supply today and it appears the price has increased $20 since my last purchase a month or so ago. What's up with that? Definitely not buying at the marked up price. But I still gave it five stars for product quality.
customer_reviews.author: OldForester

customer_reviews.title: This is great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for years. Unlike whey protein (yuck!) it tastes good. And, they've done a pretty good job of overcoming the egg white protein's non-dissovability. My only complaint is the packaging. This big jar is really not necessary - why not a collapsible, recyclable bag, instead? These big jars (which are not even full of product) take an awful lot of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie M

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I can't eat soy and I'm not really sure what whey is. I hate the taste of eggs, but really like to start my day with protein so I'm not ravenous by lunch time. This stuff tastes pretty great compared to some of the other protein products on the market. Really mixes well with some peanut butter and almond milk if you need extra calories too.
customer_reviews.author: Angela K.

customer_reviews.title: Artificial Sweeteners
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of artificial sweeteners , I'm highly allergic to them, they change names all the time to trick you
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this egg white protein. I can't have whey but want a lot of protein to make me feel full. This has a great vanilla flavor and makes a wonderful smoothie! I also like to use the mix in a smoothie when I have less than perfect digestion. It makes a soothing drink for good energy. I will definitely buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Macbethart

customer_reviews.title: Very drinkable!
customer_reviews.text: I think this stuff is pretty great. I've only tried a couple other products (and SFH) but I like the taste of this protein shake much better. I've been using it several times a week since April and still going strong! The biggest con I have is that it doesn't easily mix using a spoon. But I mostly just use a blenderbottle anyway so it's not a big deal and not worth losing a star over. Overall, I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good, but wouldn't repurchase...
customer_reviews.text: This provides a good post-workout protein boost. I wanted to try something other than whey for a change, but will go back to whey because I think I got better results. I'm a female looking for lean-muscle. In addition, I don't like the amount of sugar alcohols used in this product. It tastes okay, but I will keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: NoOne

customer_reviews.title: Required part of my regimen
customer_reviews.text: I love this with a scoop of chocolate cocoa powder, banana and some ice. This lasts a month long and is a GREAT source of protein. Keep in mind this is easier on your stomach than the pure whey protein. The ONLY downfall is that you will have some minor gas when you first start this in your morning shake.
customer_reviews.author: M3dd1e

customer_reviews.title: Eggzzatic
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but I really am happy with the product. I am lactose intolerante and egg protein is the only supplemental protein I can eat without bloating. This is a perfect post-op and pre-op preparation before any surgery that involves cutting your skin or muscle. Besides, it will give you flawless skin if taken regularly. Remember to have your liver checked, avoid this by taking a week on and a week off.
customer_reviews.author: ermovick

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to Whey
customer_reviews.text: Love the ON protein. I tried this egg protein because my friend recommended it. I don't notice any difference between this and whey protein. But if you're lactose intolerant, definite try the egg protein. My friend who can't drink whey protein love it.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC OH

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best protein shakes I have tried. It has a good vanilla taste and mixes well with fruit or other flavorings. I mix it with Almond Milk which makes it even better. Also, this does not seem to bother my stomach like some other milk-derived protein powders.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Stickin' with this Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Been lifting weights my whole life, had some problems with acne in high school that never really resolved in college. Ended up taking accutane that did some damage to my gastrointestinal tract and the doctors thing it may have caused some dairy intolerance. I knew I needed a protein because working out was one of the only thing that kept me sane (laugh out loud). Found this and thought I'd give it a try. I definitely recommend the vanilla custard, i mix one scoop with cold water and a scoop of berries and its really good. Still seeing some good gains with this protein and I plan on continuing it!
customer_reviews.author: Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I can’t eat dairy this is the best non dairy protein powder I have tired.
customer_reviews.author: Rds

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: A fairly good protein in my opinion, not the best but a good price and decent product. The salt content is very high, which some occurs naturaly but I've seen other egg protein powders with less salt. Flavor is good, not the best but ok.
customer_reviews.author: jdogb1

customer_reviews.title: EGGZACTLY PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This mixes so well.....using almond milk and frozen fruit....makes great smoothies.....mixes much better than some SOY I ordered at the same time..will be ordering more soon as I have run through this one already....number one !
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ray

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good for a supplement
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly sweet, but I like that. I has a good vanilla flavor. My surgeon recommended egg white protein smoothies every day before my surgery and during recovery. It was an easy way to get the extra protein to build up muscle and recover.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Dickau

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it's not the best tasting stuff in the world. I mean, it's egg...flavored to taste like vanilla custard. What do you expect? But it's definitely a good source of protein and helps me recover quicker after a tough workout. I'd try the chocolate instead if I were you, though.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Yost

customer_reviews.title: Taste is good
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind the taste at all. Tastes good to me, and it got here fast. . I like it as I am on a low carb and this is low carb. So works good. Would recommend this to someone looking for a low carb drink. JH
customer_reviews.author: J. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product and highly recommend to anyone who does not include grains in their diet. This is the only protein supplement I could find that does not contain grains. Love the taste, I use almond milk or water to mix it.
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: EGG-cellent!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this protein! It has a nice, rich flavor and it mixes well with water or coconut or almond milk. I highly recommend for taste and texture.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen B.

customer_reviews.title: Lactose intolerant Protein source
customer_reviews.text: I started buying Egg Protein due to my intolerance of milk based protein powders. I've found Optimum Nutrition's egg protein to be the very best. The Rich Chocolate tastes great and dissolves extremely easily in water with a shaker cup. I've tried it in soy milk and lactaid skim milk and it tasted great in both. It doesn't blend quite as well in milk as it does in water, but I found it to leave fewer chunks than Optimum's Whey Gold standard Powder. This is easily my favorite protein powder I've tried and I have it every morning. I only wish it came in larger sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Splinter TheNinja Dog

customer_reviews.title: So much better than whey protein
customer_reviews.text: I put a scoop of this over my Trader Joe's Steel Cut Oatmeal for breakfast. I tried that same recipe with some Whey protein and it turned to a sandy mess in the bowl. This has a nice subtle flavor. Yum!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: powder
customer_reviews.text: the taste is awful it has a good amount of protein but its hard to figure out what to mix it with because it has such an awful taste
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hell yes
customer_reviews.text: Great contents. Great taste. Quality product. I take this as either post-workout or at any random time during the day when I feel as if it has been too long since I ingested some nutrients.
customer_reviews.author: Rageous

customer_reviews.title: Contains SOY LECITHIN, SUCRALOSE and Artificial flavor
customer_reviews.text: Can't exactly be 100% egg protein when it has all kinds of other crap in it. It's very, very, very sweet and has a ton of vanilla fake flavoring. Because of the soy junk in it, it dissolves easily in liquids. I'm sure all the people who whine about bad tasting ACTUAL Egg White Protein powders which don't instantly dissolve in liquids (protein doesn't) will love this stuff, but it's definitely not for me. I paid for 2 lbs of protein, not 2 lbs of sugar, fake flavoring and genetically modified soy poison.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for lactose intolerant people
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for us lactose intolerant folks. Very little sugar as well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reuben Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the taste of Whey
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to give Egg protein a try and found it okay for the first few weeks but afterwards I just couldn't stomach the particular taste. Back to Whey for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Best vanilla egg white protein
customer_reviews.text: This is the best egg white protein powder around. It mixes well, tastes great and can be added to everything. Makes great shakes with any fruit or veggie. I have even added it in to foods I bake. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jinx

customer_reviews.title: Tasty with lots of protein
customer_reviews.text: Great value for amount of protein delivered per serving. The taste is really great for a protein powder. I continue to use this product every day.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Taste Ever
customer_reviews.text: My favorite out of all the Optimum brands proteins. Absolute best taste. Supposedly better for you as well. I'm not much of an expert when it comes to supplements, but this is my fav.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rustlips

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Taste great. Good texture. Good value. Easy to to mix. We love it. Makes a great breakfast drink with juice and fruit.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, smooth texture
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this protein powder to any vegetarian or dairy-sensitive person. It is a bit more expensive than milk based powders, but it is very easy to digest. I eat this protein powder daily in shakes and oatmeal. The flavor is good, no strange after taste or chemical flavors. Be careful, if you get it too hot, it forms a strange sponge like texture, sort of like baked eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Ayla Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Good.  Does not raise my blood sugar.
customer_reviews.text: I am an insulin dependant diabetic. I have two servings as my morning meal with no insulin bolus. Taste good, fills me up and does not raise my blood sugar
customer_reviews.author: Timothy C Summers Jr

customer_reviews.title: The power of Egg protein!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't do well on Whey, Soy, milk,etc. protein powder. Due to G.I. track issues I have to be careful with my protein's. I can honestly say that when I'm on my Gold Standard Egg protein(chocolate, best tasting-And I'm peticular),I have endurance,energy,and satisfction. My stomach is happy/comfortable. I take my egg protein a couple times a day. Kids love it, too! Finally there's an alternative to all the others. Enjoy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Morning ritual
customer_reviews.text: My husband makes fresh fruit smoothies every morning. Egg protein is more difficult to find and this is the only brand he will use.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Freaking awesome stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I can't do whey protein, so I have been trying various brands of egg protein, this has to be my favorite. As for the flavor, its great (I have the rich chocolate, sounds like the other flavors might not be as good.) In powder form it smells odd, but once its mixed with liquid in no longer stinks.
customer_reviews.author: FAT_AL

customer_reviews.title: Morning breakfast
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a blender add peanut butter and ice, or strawberries w/banana. Great protein shake! Will purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great
customer_reviews.text: Let me start with, I'm not a body builder. My trainer recommended egg protein over whey. Another reviewer said this tasted wonderful and it does. Mixing requires a bit of shaking. I really enjoy drinking the mix. Great way to boost my protein while busy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin arms

customer_reviews.title: High Protein and pretty tasty
customer_reviews.text: 110 Calories and 24 Grams of protien per scoop is pretty good. The texture is thick and it tastes like vanilla jello pudding. This flavor can get old after a few days but its a supplement so just get it down.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It tastes a bit like raw egg and smells as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: good protein
customer_reviews.text: I like this protein, can't have the whey. So this is a great substitute to still get in the protein. Not too many extra ingredients in it. Taste pretty good. I think the chocolate version is a better though.
customer_reviews.author: joel rothermel

customer_reviews.title: Great product and tastes good.
customer_reviews.text: I mix it with unsweetened almond breeze almond milk and it tastes amazing. When I take other proteins that contain whey (dairy) it causes my acne to flare up unfortunately. This is a great protein powder substitute if you are acne prone.
customer_reviews.author: triumphdaytona675

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this protein. I have been using almost one year. I love the results and I,m lactose intolerant and this is perfect to me. I shake it with MILK 100% LACTOSE FREE, is the only way to have a great taste, because I don't like it with juice or water it taste horrible. I like it only with MILK 100% LACTOSE FREE.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Good but no safety seal.
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as expected, except for one thing. There was no safety seal. This is slightly off-putting. I'll probably order from another merchant next time, unless the safety seal situation is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I mixed mine with cold coffee instead of water or milk and it tasted just like an iced mocha. I didn't notice any aftertaste, but the coffee may have helped. I hate eating breakfast, so this is a quick, easy, and filling solution. I'm not a fan of the packaging though. It was literally half full upon opening, so this giant container is a waste of cabinet space.
customer_reviews.author: DifuPDX

customer_reviews.title: Hits the spot
customer_reviews.text: Tastes just fine, not much foam, and mixes well with plain ol' water (I would recommend using cold water). Pour water in first then powder and it won't clump as bad.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Tasted Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Tried mixing it with Nesquick chocolate milk mix to amp the chocolate flavor but the pungent egg raste keeps coming through.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Great source of protien
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product exclusively for a about 6 months now. Its great in smoothies after a hard workout, it provides the BCAA's that my body needs and its gently on the gut.
customer_reviews.author: james carroll

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The taste isn't that great. And I usually love ON products
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I Love it !! I drink it every morning !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get all the protein needed to start the day.
customer_reviews.author: brian lintz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have that protein aftertaste or texture. Great before or after a workout. I purchase this product every month and will continue.
customer_reviews.author: EPN

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Tastes great and does not irritate my stomach as advertised. Would highly recommend to those who are lactose intolerant. Would and will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tia G

customer_reviews.title: Great product add an awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: I am lactose intolerant so at this price and quality I am extremely happy with the results. I will recommend this to anybody I know who weight lifts.
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Packed with protein and other good ingrediance with a very pleasing flavor. You get a lot for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste
customer_reviews.text: The taste is amazing!!!!! It's just like licking the brownie mix off the beaters. It leaves me feeling full and satisfied .
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Clumps together and gives you a stomach ache!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not dissolve well even if you follow the instructions and smash it with a spoon. Even in small quatities it gives the user an upset stomach. It think it may stick to your stomach like like it sticks to the glass. I went to the health food store and tried another egg protein by another manufacturer with good results, the other protein I tried dissolved well and did not give any negative results, so I verified it's not me, or something else I ate. Also, I tried this protein on two seperate occasions with different amounts and got the same results. DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Lactose free and non-soy protein
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why it's so hard to find a dairy-free protein powder which isn't soy-based. Powder tastes good, mixes well, and is a lot easier to digest. I can't have dairy and I have had no issues with this powder. I will definitely continue to order this product.
customer_reviews.author: aareguitar

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had to throw this product away as it made me feel dizzy and light-headed. It may work for others.
customer_reviews.author: Queen

customer_reviews.title: Easily dissolves into liquid without adding any weird flavor
customer_reviews.text: Easily dissolves into liquid without adding any weird flavor. great for mixing with various fruits and flavors for a shake. really keeps me full and I use it at work when I cannot slip out for lunch or as an afternoon snack before the commute home and our late dinners.
customer_reviews.author: Family Zookeeper

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best protein powder around...
customer_reviews.text: ON changed the name of this product, but it's still there 100% egg white (albumin) protein... I take this with me to the gym or bicycling, at home I tend to use use pure dried egg whites (those don't work too well at the gym since they're no emulsifiers in them, the ON works great).. On the go (gym or bicycling) I mix it with water, at home generally I mix it with non-fat milk... As far as the "value" -- you'll have to decide, it's good quality protein, and seems to help me keep lean and defined.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Not My Favorite, but it Will Do
customer_reviews.text: I like to avoid Soy at all cost. Soy defenders will tell you that there is nothing wrong with soy and it is a great source of protein, etc. However, my research and the word of nutritionists and trainers I know and respect tell me to stay away from soy at all costs. Pound for pound, egg white protein is better, or at worst just as good, as any comparable whey product. Great absorption, not so rough on the stomach. The vanilla flavor is pretty good, considering how awful most vanilla flavored protein supplements there are out there. I really have no complaints about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard B. Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I drink this EGG protein shake every morning. In an 8 oz glass I fill it 3/4 with unsweetened chocolate almond milk which is hardly any calories or carbs, put in one scoop of this protein powder and a few drops of Sweetleaf chocolate flavor sweetener which is 0 calories or carbs and I have a fantastic protein shake every morning which keeps me full until around 2:00 at which time I have a healthy lunch then a light meal for dinner. I've lost 15 lbs in the last couple of weeks doing this (along with swimming every day) I'll definitely be keeping this in stock in my pantry at all times!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Good protein source especially for those that can't tolerate whey
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good quality protein powder but can not tolerate whey (which most products contain), prefer not to have soy protein, and did not like rice protein. I found information on this product and it is a great high quality protein that is easily digestible, and has very low carbs and fats since it is made with egg whites. Some reviews complained about the taste, but I mix it with Crystal light, or sugar free vanilla almond milk with berries and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tropigal

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this to any weight lifter
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed the product. It tastes pretty good. My body wasn't taking well to whey protein (I would get breakouts on my face) so I switched to egg protein. I've been happy with my switch and this is one of the better egg proteins that I've had. I typically work out 3-5 times a week and this is great for my post workout drink. Sometimes I blend it with peanut butter and banana for a delicious post workout, recovery drink. I would certainly recommend this product to any workout enthusiast or someone who it just getting into it.
customer_reviews.author: Deem222

customer_reviews.title: Pro Complex is better
customer_reviews.text: I love optimum nutrition and think they are one of the better supplement makers out there. This product is good if you are just look for a little standard protein to add in a shake or mix with some yogurt. But if you are buying it to build muscle, get the Pro Complex blend. It works much better in the gains department. If you want to bulk, get the Pro Complex Gainer. Other than that, the vanilla is my favorite flavor. Also this is very easy on my digestive system, unlike others I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Mullaney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent taste!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the "Rich Chocolate" flavor of this product, and I am so happy with this stuff! It arrived within 2 days of my ordering it (which is nothing short of miraculous since I live on the Oregon coast!) The taste is great and it mixes easily. After a week of using it at least once per day, I am seeing great results on my 4HB diet. I have told all my friends and coworkers about this stuff. If you are hesitating, please don't! The product is an all-around 5-star earner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Egg Protein
customer_reviews.text: This is a delicious alternative to chocolate whey protein. I have a sensitivity to the whey, so I thought this would be a good alternative. I used about half of the tub when I realized it also contains soy and I have a soy allergy. I'm not sure what amount of soy this product has, but I didn't want to risk it and chose another brand of protein. But besides the whole soy thing, this is a very good tasting powder. This is a great protein to cook with, I used it to make my post-workout protein pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: AmberHale

customer_reviews.title: This is a good Paleo protein powder option
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Paleo protein powder option. We mix one scoop of this with 16 ounces unsweetened almond milk in a blender bottle. The flavor isn't overly sweet. This product is pricey and availability is not consistent. A cheaper (and much more available option) is the Maximum Human Performance Paleo Protein Supplement, Triple Chocolate -
customer_reviews.author: Lisarra

customer_reviews.title: Finally a protein shake that isn't too sweet
customer_reviews.text: Much better tasting than Pro Complex. It doesn't have that fake sweetener taste. I added a bit of cocoa and it tasted like a chocolate milk shake. **Update, while I still like this brand better than others, I found I didn't like the 100% egg powder taste after a while. It had a weird tang or something. Now I'm using the Optimum Nutrition Natural Pro Complex in Vanilla (you can always add cocoa when you want chocolate).
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent easy mixing great tasting protein
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product literally for years. It is some of the easiest mixing, best tasting, high quality protein on the market. Whey protein is always the trendy way to go, but egg protein has an outstanding amino profile and absorbed at a little slower pace. I am not lactose tolerant and have zero issues with this protein and my stomach. Outstanding product and the best egg protein I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Ashbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews talking about how bad it tastes. I have to disagree. Vanilla tastes just like every other Whey Vanilla I have ever tasted. No grit and smooth. Very tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Calle

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting
customer_reviews.text: I have a dairy allergy so I can't have any whey or casein products. I workout hard and need my protein. This is the best tasting protein powder I have ever had. It mixes so well and taste great. I mix it in my shakes with fruits and spinach. But I will also make a banana protein pudding and the flavor is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lumadue

customer_reviews.title: Great to go!
customer_reviews.text: On those days when I don't have the time for breakfast it's great to have my Egg Protein mix on hand. I just put some mix in my water bottle, add cold water, shake it up, add crushed ice and go! I find that adding the ice AFTER I shake it up means no lumps! I like the vanilla custard flavor. Also, the colder it is, the better it tastes.
customer_reviews.author: K's Books and More

customer_reviews.title: Kid friendly too!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son has been lifting weights with me for about the last year and a half. We have been looking for a good protein powder for him, but since he is lactose intolerant, whey protein is not an option. I purchased this product for him and when he tried it for the first time last night he LOVED it. (I have never heard of anyone really liking the taste of protein powder, but he sure did). For the record, we mixed the scoop of powder with about 4 oz. of almond milk. It needed a lot of stirring to dissipate, but it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus Rahl

customer_reviews.title: Great Shake
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. For people dealing with the aftertaste, I mix two scoops with 12 oz of water and three ice cubes and I can barely taste it anymore. In other words, it dissolves fine if you use enough water and it tastes fine if it's cold. 4 stars instead of 5 because I don't like that I'm getting 36% of my salt for the day with two scoops. Honestly though, I'm nitpicking, it's pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Pink

customer_reviews.title: Protein Brotein
customer_reviews.text: I really like all things protein made by Optimum Nutrition. I have yet to find one of their products that wasn't as advertised. This slower digesting protein makes for a really good snack shake and I've even used it for a meal replacement.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Tastes excellent, enjoy as a dessert.
customer_reviews.text: Started drinking the chocolate flavor before going to bed about a month ago. I love it and have found it tastes rich and chocolatey enough to satisfy my post-dinner sweet cravings. As to the quality of the protein, I'm not expert enough to judge. Optimum Nutrition makes good products, so I feel comfortable trusting this one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Clark

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GREAT product!!
customer_reviews.text: The best! I had weight loss surgery and this helped me lose the required weight before i had surgery. I lost 82 lbs using this product a a simple meal replacement twice a day and eating and sensible third meal and exercising daily. I love the taste and the carbs were low!
customer_reviews.author: BigBoyRoy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful supplement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father who is in his eighties. The dose I give him is much less than prescribed, nevertheless it has had almost a miraculous effect on his energy and vitality.
customer_reviews.author: rmd

customer_reviews.title: great for mixers
customer_reviews.text: This protein is pretty decent tasting with milk or any kind.. not so great with water. But it does mix well and I typically put it in smoothies so it definitely gets the job done and a versatile flavor. just not so fond of it by itself.. maybe in chocolate though it would be better
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have tried many protein products, we found this one to be the best for us. It has a great chocolate flavor and mixes easily. We like the amount of protein and low sugar (<1g). We are both counting carbs, and this one is very low (5g) We plan on using this for a long time to come!
customer_reviews.author: Mel A. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent taste
customer_reviews.text: I switch back and forth from egg to whey. This tastes great, but I mix it with Source of Life granola flavor shake. Tastes like a granola bar with vanilla icing that way. No mixing or digestion issues. VERY fine powder.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Long

customer_reviews.title: good protein powder
customer_reviews.text: turns out i am allergic to whey protien so i switched to this egg protein and have had zero issues with it. it tastes good and its pretty easy to mix up in a shake bottle. drink it with milk and it tastes delicious.
customer_reviews.author: mjohns19

customer_reviews.title: Best Protein Ever
customer_reviews.text: As someone who is lactose intolerant/ won't consume dairy this egg protein is a staple in my workout diet. I never feel bloated after drinking it, and it doesn't even clump up or anything in my shake bottle. Just mix it up before my workout, give it another shake just before consumption, and drink the proteiny goodness. THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING PRODUCT!!! (Both Chocolate/Vanilla)
customer_reviews.author: Luke Warner

customer_reviews.title: Good taste and has helped me put on some muscle mass
customer_reviews.text: This product definitely works. Gained muscle and strength after having this. Taste is pretty good too. I take it with water. Does mix reasonably well but not very well. It does not cause bloating either. I prefer this over whey or any protein bar. However, don't know all of a sudden product has become so expensive. Selling for about $55 for 2lbs now. I used to buy it for around $30.
customer_reviews.author: James Taylor

customer_reviews.title: But this by far is my favorite protein. It's all I'll buy from now on
customer_reviews.text: Over priced. Found it for 40$ at most other places. Wish I did more research. But this by far is my favorite protein. It's all I'll buy from now on:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great
customer_reviews.text: This powder in vanilla custard is amazing. It mixes up well (blender or shaker) and tastes wonderful. Yesterday I added a drop of lemon extract and it was almost like lemon meringue pie. Best of all, no tummy upset like with whey.
customer_reviews.author: Colette Vallee

customer_reviews.title: Vanilla Custard, NOT so delicious.
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to like this. The taste is just really horrible. (I know that taste is objective, so I didn't give it the lowest score.) That said, we have five daily protein shake drinkers in our household and none of us like it. We've tried mixing it with milk, water, almond milk, juice, fruit -- I hate the thought of wasting it, but no one can stomach it. It has a slightly metallic taste. I'm not sure if I'm willing to try the other flavors or if we'll just search for another brand, but we definitely won't purchase Optimum Nutrition 100% Egg Protein in Vanilla Custard again.
customer_reviews.author: ThatMom

customer_reviews.title: Best Protein Powder
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best protein powder that I have found so far. It tastes much better than all the rest that I have found. It also works the best for those of use who are lactose intolerant.
customer_reviews.author: bookwormTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: it's protein
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because of my lactose intolerance. it does upset my stomach a little and is a given considering it doesn't say its dairy free but just a warning for anyone looking to buy this because it isn't made with whey
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Olmstead

product_meta.title: Optimum Nutrition 100% Egg Protein, Vanilla Custard, 2 Pound
product_meta.description:
Many nutrition experts consider eggs to be the Gold Standard for protein quality. Eggs are a complete protein containing all of the Essential Amino Acids that play an important role in muscle recovery. Eggs are also naturally free of lactose, making them an attractive alternative to dairy-based proteins. Each 120 to 130 calorie serving (depending on flavor) of GOLD STANDARD 100% Egg contains as much protein as 7 egg whites with no saturated fat and just 15 mg of cholesterol.

AMAZON.COM


Nutritionists commonly refer to eggs as the "gold standard" for protein quality because they're very easily digested and contain generous amounts of all eight essential amino acids. Eggs are naturally free of lactose, so they're also much more "forgiving" to athletes who have trouble with dairy foods or milk-based protein powders. Optimum Nutrition's Gold Standard 100% Egg takes the benefits a step further by virtually eliminating the fat and cholesterol found in whole eggs. Each scoop of Gold Standard 100% Egg packs as much protein as seven egg whites and only 2 grams of carbs. By also making this formula instantized to mix easily, Optimum Nutrition may have elevated the egg to a higher status.

Quality Counts: GMP Certified Products
Optimum Nutrition's commitment to quality is evident throughout the entire product development process. As a continued measure of quality, all vendors must provide a Certificate of Analysis for each raw material supplied. The certified analyses are also verified through random in-house and independent laboratory testing. To further diminish any chance of physical, chemical, and microbiological contaminants, ON has established and implemented a Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) program. Quality assurance professionals make routine checks on all storage, blending, and production areas and conduct daily inspections.

ON is proud that its in-house manufacturing operation has been registered under the NSF International, The Public Health and Safety Company, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) Program. Together, these practices and procedures allow ON to consistently deliver first-rate sports nutrition supplements under the strictest quality control standards.


About Optimum Nutrition: True Strength
Since 1986, Optimum Nutrition has been supporting the nutrition goals of elite athletes and goal-driven individuals around the world. Building on a foundation of company owned and operated production facilities, unparalleled manufacturing expertise, and uncompromising quality standards, ON continually strives to bring athletes and active individuals sports nutrition solutions designed to make a real difference in performance. Whether your goals involve strength, speed, power, endurance - or any combination - ON supplements work as hard as you do. Realize your True Strength with the quality and innovation leader.

What's in the Box
Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard 100% Egg, Delicious Vanilla Custard, 2 pounds.
feature_bullets: Nutritionists commonly refer to eggs as the Gold Standard for protein quality
